instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute (2145 Sheridan Road), Room F253, Evanston

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This is the first course in a two-quarter sequence which covers advanced classical mechanics. Topics in 330-1 include Newtonian mechanics, conservation laws, Lagrangian mechanics, and central-force motion. Special topics may also be introduced.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Phyx 135-1,2,3, Math 220, 224, and 240, Math 250- have taken or concurrently enrolled in. Or equivalents.
More detailed prerequisites will be posted on departmental web site.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Three one-hour lectures and a one-hour discussion per week. New material can be introduced in discussion. It is not optional.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Final and one or more midterm examinations. Home work.
